boat.name: Wilhelmina Maria
boat.full_description:
'Wilhenmina Maria' was built in 1895 at Paendrect by Van del Andel. A Dutch sailing barge, she was originally used to transport gravel and sand from the sea gates in southern Holland to the River Ijssel.

After the second world war she was used as a houseboat by the church for people who had been bombed out. In 1976 she was rebuilt by Han Wever and Roos Kuipur at Edam. She was then bought by John Clenshaw and Barbara Carol who lived on board and ran a signwriting business on the Thames. She changed hands again in 2001.
boat.short_description: 'Wilhelmina Maria' is a Hollandse Tjalk, a Dutch sailing barge.
